abstract.text: An interface that enables people to interact with recognized text, barcodes, and other objects in an image.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: This class enables people to interact with specific content types (
) that the framework identifies in an image. For example:
The Live Text interface enables them to select any text present in the image (
), or invoke a URL (
). The text selection UI offers framework-standard buttons for copying selected text, or looking it up on the web for more information.
The
subject lift
feature identifies a wide variety of objects, or
subjects
, in images with the
interaction type, and provides your app with an image of the objects with the background removed. The
type supplements this feature by adding a button in the bottom corner of the view that people can click or tap for more information about the recognized subjects.

content.text: Configure the interface and begin interaction

inlineContent.text: This class conforms to the
protocol. To connect the interface with an image that your app displays, call
on your appâ€™s image view and pass in a new instance of this class.
Choose the items that the framework recognizes in an image by configuring the
property. To recognize all types of content, specify the
option, or choose a combination of types by assigning an array:
To begin interaction, call one of the
classâ€™s
methods, such as
and set the result onto this classâ€™s
property.
You can take more control over the interaction or provide details about your appâ€™s image view by implementing a delegate (
) and assigning it to the
property. If your image view isnâ€™t an instance of
, your app needs to define the interactive area within the image by implementing the
method.

abstract.text: Identify and extract information in the environment using the deviceâ€™s camera, or in images that your app displays.
An object that represents the results of analyzing an image, and provides
the input for the Live Text interface object.
An interface that enables people to interact with recognized text, barcodes, and other objects in an image.
The types of interactions that people can perform with an image.
An option that enables interaction with any type of text, symbols, or subjects that the framework recognizes.
An option that enables interaction with text of certain formats,
such as URLs, email addresses, and physical addresses.
An option that enables people to use a long-press gesture on a subject in an image to separate it from the background.
An option that enables text selection, copying, and translating.
An option that presents a button for more information on any subjects the framework recognizes in the image.
An area of interest in an image that the framework identifies as a primary focal point.
Error conditions that can occur during subject analysis.
The types of interactions that a person actively performs.
A Boolean value that indicates whether people can press and hold text to
activate data detectors.
The results of analyzing an image for items that people can interact
with.
Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the analysis finds text
at the specified point.
A rectangle, in unit coordinate space, that describes the content area
of the interaction.
The delegate that handles the interaction callbacks.
Performs an action after the view adds or removes the interaction from
its interaction array.
A Boolean value that indicates whether a person or the app has text selected within the image.
Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the analysis detects data
at the specified point.
Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether active text, data
detectors, or supplementary interface objects exist at the specified
point.
Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether supplementary interface
objects exist at the specified point.
Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether active text exists at the
specified point.
All highlighted subjects in the interaction image.
Provides an image asynchronously that contains the given subjects with the background removed.
Creates an interaction for Live Text actions with items in an image.
Creates an interaction for Live Text actions with the specified
delegate.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the view hides supplementary
interface objects.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the Live Text button appears.
The types of interactions that people can perform with the image.
Removes a personâ€™s text selection from the interface.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the interaction highlights
actionable text or data the analyzer detects in text.
The current selected attributed text.
Sets selected text ranges.
The current selected text.
Informs the view that contains the image when the layout changes and the
view needs to reload its content.
Hides or shows supplementary interface objects, such as the Live Action
button and Quick Actions, depending on the item type.
Returns the subject at the given point within the interactionâ€™s image, if one exists.
The set of all subjects the framework identifies in an image.
The distances the edges of content are inset from the supplementary
interface.
The font to use for the supplementary interface.
The text contents of the current image analysis.
The view that uses this interaction.
Performs an action before the view adds or removes the interaction from
its interaction array.
A delegate that handles image-analysis and user-interaction callbacks for an interaction object.
Returns the rectangle, in unit coordinates, that contains the image within the view.
A view that enables people to interact with recognized text, barcodes, and other objects in an image.
The results of analyzing an image for items that people can interact with.
A delegate that handles image-analysis and user-interaction callbacks for an overlay view.
An object that finds items in images that people can interact with, such
as subjects, text, and QR codes.
Returns the data for providing a Live Text interaction with an image.
Add a Live Text interface that enables users to perform actions with text and QR
codes that appear in images.

abstract.text: A view that displays a single image or a sequence of animated images in your interface.
The protocol that an interaction implements to access the view that owns it.
Adds an interaction to the view.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
The protocol that an interaction implements to access the view that owns it.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
